name: AddReferenceToObject
description:
Add a reference to an object's property.

This tool adds a new reference to a specified property of a data object. The object is identified by its class and UUID. Use this to link related objects within a dataset.

parameters.name: source_class_name
parameters.description: Name of the collection (class) the source object belongs to.

value_schema.description: Name of the collection (class) the source object belongs to.

parameters.name: source_object_uuid
parameters.description: Unique UUID identifying the source object to which the reference will be added.

value_schema.description: Unique UUID of the source object.

parameters.name: reference_property_name
parameters.description: Unique name of the reference property of the source object to which the reference will be added.

value_schema.description: Unique name of the reference property of the source object.

parameters.name: reference_to_add
parameters.description: JSON object detailing the reference to add, specifying properties such as class, schema, beacon URI, and optional classification metadata.

class.description: If using a concept reference (rather than a direct reference), specify the desired collection (class) name here.

schema.description: Names and values of an individual property. A returned response may also contain additional metadata, such as from classification or feature projection.

beacon.description: If using a direct reference, specify the URI to point to the cross-reference here. Should be in the form of weaviate://localhost/<uuid> for the example of a local cross-reference to an object

href.description: If using a direct reference, this read-only fields provides a link to the referenced resource. If 'origin' is globally configured, an absolute URI is shown - a relative URI otherwise.

overallCount.description: overall neighbors checked as part of the classification. In most cases this will equal k, but could be lower than k - for example if not enough data was present

winningCount.description: size of the winning group, a number between 1..k

losingCount.description: size of the losing group, can be 0 if the winning group size equals k

closestOverallDistance.description: The lowest distance of any neighbor, regardless of whether they were in the winning or losing group

winningDistance.description: deprecated - do not use, to be removed in 0.23.0

meanWinningDistance.description: Mean distance of all neighbors from the winning group

closestWinningDistance.description: Closest distance of a neighbor from the winning group

closestLosingDistance.description: The lowest distance of a neighbor in the losing group. Optional. If k equals the size of the winning group, there is no losing group

losingDistance.description: deprecated - do not use, to be removed in 0.23.0

meanLosingDistance.description: Mean distance of all neighbors from the losing group. Optional. If k equals the size of the winning group, there is no losing group.

classification.description: This meta field contains additional info about the classified reference property

parameters.name: required_consistency_level
parameters.description: Specifies the number of replicas that must acknowledge a request for it to be successful.

value_schema.description: Determines how many replicas must acknowledge a request before it is considered successful.

parameters.name: tenant_identifier
parameters.description: Specifies the tenant for multi-tenant collection requests in a Weaviate class.

value_schema.description: Specifies the tenant in a request targeting a multi-tenant collection (class).

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the weaviate API.

parameters.name: consistency_level
parameters.description: Determines how many replicas must acknowledge a request before it is considered successful.

value_schema.description: Determines how many replicas must acknowledge a request before it is considered successful.

parameters.name: tenant
parameters.description: Specifies the tenant in a request targeting a multi-tenant collection (class).

value_schema.description: Specifies the tenant in a request targeting a multi-tenant collection (class).

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: Name of the collection (class) the source object belongs to.

value_schema.description: Name of the collection (class) the source object belongs to.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique UUID of the source object.

value_schema.description: Unique UUID of the source object.

parameters.name: propertyName
parameters.description: Unique name of the reference property of the source object.

value_schema.description: Unique name of the reference property of the source object.

schema.description: Names and values of an individual property. A returned response may also contain additional metadata, such as from classification or feature projection.
